results.title: Lovers on the ninth bridge = Les Amants du Pont-Neuf
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Christian Fechner, Films A2 and Les Films Christian Fechner
results.brief_description: One of the most beautifully shot and expensive French films ever made, this is a stunning tale of unexpected love, tragedy and man’s boundless capacity for joy. Juliette Binoche is Michele, a young painter trying to escape the one great tragedy in her life. She is slowly but surely going blind. Dennis Lavant is a street performer who shares his makeshift home, Paris’ Pont Neuf, with a drunken father figure, Hans. By chance Michele stumbles into Alex’s disturbing down and out life. Her pitiable state arouses compassion in Alex for the first time in his life. Love finds Alex and in a world of despair and mere existence he is surprised by joy. In English with French subtitles.

results.title: Lover boy. Bonza
results.creator_credit: David Swann, Geoffrey Wright, Daniel Scharf, Deborah Hoare and Bonza Productions
results.brief_description: This video contains two Australian short films. “Lover Boy” portrays a painfully impossible liaison between a 16 year old boy and a 45 year old woman. Brought together by loneliness and their bleak environment, they find some short-lived comfort in each other’s arms. Stars Noah Taylor, Gillian Jones, Ben Mendelsohn. “Bonza” gives a view of Australian suburban family life through the eyes of a dog. Stars Peter Rowsthorn, Peter Green, Maureen Edwards, Susie Dee.

results.title: Lover boy
results.brief_description: Set in Melbourne’s industrialised Western suburbs, “LoverBoy” is a dramatic story of love and revenge. It is the story of a love affair between a 16 year old boy, Mick, and a 45 year old woman, Sally. Brought together by loneliness and their bleak environment, they find some short- lived comfort in each other’s arms. But what begins innocently, degenerates into bitterness and violence, and leads to a shattering conclusion in which their lives are changed forever. Cast includes Gillian Jones, Noah Taylor, Alice Garner and Ben Mendelsohn.

results.title: Lovely
results.brief_description: In Ruth Carr’s arresting vignette, a woman rises every morning to put on her mask for the world, terrified that her husband will glimpse the real face beneath. As the camera explores in stark close-up the landscape of this aging woman’s body, Lovely contemplates on the underbelly of the beauty industry, the ravages of time, and what people will do in the name of love. Cast features Greta Lindholm and Ken Snodgrass.

results.title: Loved, honoured and bruised
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, Jerry Krepakevich and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Jeannie who was married for 16 years to a man who physically and mentally abused her. Now separated from her husband, Jeannie tells her story in two voices: a dispassionate one when she addresses the camera, and an emotional one when she discusses her situation with a social worker. Her husband is also interviewed.

results.title: Lovebird's nests = Yuan yang lou
results.creator_credit: Zheng Dongtian, Beijing Film Academy, Liu Ying and Wang Peigong
results.brief_description:
The story follows six newly-wed couples living in the same apartment block; it examines how these ordinary small families cope with their everyday lives and how they retain their ‘joie de vivre’. A young working couple is passionate and cheerful, but their lack of education and manners reflect their life with capricious mood swings and constant arguments. The director’s wife is gentle and kindhearted, and even though the family is full of gentle warmth, their life is often plain and tasteless, leading them to question their passion for each other. The artist couple suffers from repression, one is often silent and uncommunicative, the other is narrow-minded and often filled with jealousy; the arrival of a young female art student commences a period of uncertain instability of their everyday life, however it also triggers them to reveal their inner passion for each other. A couple with an appreciable age gap is under distress from disharmonious sexual life, though after self-adjustments, the couple restores their satisfactory domesticity. A sophisticated scholar’s couple has great spirits for achievement, therefore in reflection, their lifestyle stands far away from the secular warmth and happiness of regular families. The “Salon” nature of the last family means the couple will always suffer under outside infestations, their lives are left powerless, but habitually not without pleasure and love for each other. Clearly, the world is not built on perfection; however, the true happiness really lies within the trivial, everyday life.
(Wendy Xu, 2014)
